Your letter of September 18 to John talking about the
"Utilization Kits" touches a project near to my heart.
There is certainly a great need for material to help new
teachers develop utilization techniques for both tele¬
vision and radio.
In going through my files prior to coming to KTCA,
I came across several letters concerning this project.
Both Jack McBride at KUON and Mike Ambrosino at WGBH-TV
said they would be willing to develop a kinescope program
dealing with utilization techniques.
I think it would be a good idea if the Utilization
Committee would spend some time giving serious consider¬
ation to this project at the Detroit meeting. I have
written Gale Adkins to see if he is planning on holding
a general Utilization Committee meeting. If he has not
made plans for such a meeting, I will attempt to get the
Television Sub-committee together. As for my involvement
in the project John has left the decision up to me. It
is as you can gather, a matter of having enough time on
hand. It is foolish to say that I will do this in my
spare time because this commodity just does not exist.
I think, however, that these materials are so important
that I will find the necessary time. I am flattered that
you want me to work on the project. I’ll do my best. If
